channel.description: Recent content in Basics of Statistical Programming and Data Manipulation (W35-36) on Social / Business Data Science 2022

item.title: Basics Statistical Programming
item.description: Theory part is general, Python application part hands-on and language specific. This session is a basic introduction to statistical programming as well as a short brush-up on data more generally. For some, this will be “old news”, but many will certainly benefit from reviewing this material. We start with a general theory lecture on data structures and properties, and then dive into R and Python specific applications of statistical programming.
